comments:
The problem is that the Eclipse workbench, randomly popups an Internal error   
window, that reads as shown below, 

   "An out of memory error has occurred. You can prevent these errors in the
future by increasing your heap size before you start the workbench using -vmargs
-Xmx command line option.
     You are recommended to exit the workbench
      Subsequent errors may happen and may terminate the workbench without     
    warning. "

  I have attached the few important portions from .log file for your reference
below.

------------------- .log file --------------------

!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 Jul 20, 2004 10:20:19.659
!MESSAGE Error
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexerModelListener.processDelta(IndexerModelListener.java:66)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexerModelListener.processDelta(IndexerModelListener.java:97)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexerModelListener.elementChanged(IndexerModelListener.java:48)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:628)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 Jul 20, 2004 10:40:38.640
!MESSAGE Background Indexer Crash Recovery
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

This is the desired behaviour.  We have no way to 'recover' from an
OutOfMemoryError other than to restart the workbench.  The dialog is our way of
telling you that.
